title: High Government Investment in Primary Education
description: In 2015, Serbia allocated 43.65% of its GDP per capita to government expenditure per student in primary education, indicating a strong commitment to educational investment.

title: Empowerment of Women in Health Decisions
description: As of 2019, 96.2% of Serbian women aged 15-49 made their own informed decisions regarding sexual relations, contraceptive use, and reproductive health care, showcasing significant empowerment.

title: Low Multidimensional Poverty Rate
description: In 2019, only 0.1% of Serbia's population was living in multidimensional poverty, reflecting a low poverty headcount ratio.

title: Minimal Deaths by Injury
description: In 2019, injuries accounted for just 2.37% of total deaths in Serbia, indicating effective safety and health measures.

title: Negative Net Bilateral Aid from Finland
description: In 2022, Serbia experienced a negative net bilateral aid flow from Finland, amounting to -$4,099,999.90, highlighting a financial outflow rather than support.

title: Negative Official Flows from UNECE
description: In 2015, Serbia had a negative net official flow from UNECE, totaling -$961.99, indicating a financial outflow rather than incoming support.
